# Create a plain histogram

```{r plain-histogram}
# Set seed
set.seed(0188)

# Create dataframe of 1000 random values
df_rand <- rnorm(1000, 100, 15)

# Create a histogram
base_hist <- hist(df_rand)
```

## Add colour

```{r colour-histogram}
par(col = "black",
    bg = "black")

hist(df_rand)
```
  
```{r}
# Set.seed
set.seed(0182)

# Generate random variables
dat <- data.frame(var_one = rnorm(1000, 100, 15),
                  var_two = rnorm(1000, 100, 15)) 
```

  
  
## Modify font

```{r font-histogram}
#quartzFonts(carlito = c(“Carlito”, “Carlito, Bold”, “Carlito, Regular Italitc”, 
#“Carlito, Bold Italic”))

par(family = "Helvetica",
    font.main = 1)

hist(df_rand,
     main = "Coloured histogram of 1000 random values",
     col = "dodgerblue1",
     border = "white",
     xlab = NULL,
     ylab = NULL)

```
